definition: essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
United Kingdom/British/England/English/abbr. for 英國|英国[Ying1 guo2]

sentences.english: He pillaged the country of its treasures and of its best people.
sentences.chinese: 他掠奪了這個國家的財富和百姓中的精英。

sentences.english: A massive mobilisation of talent will be needed.
sentences.chinese: 動員大量的業內精英也是非常必要的。

sentences.english: What if I'm tired of playing YMCAs or the Boys and Girls Clubs? I want to step into the elite competition.
sentences.chinese: 如果我厭倦了與小孩子的比賽，我會參加精英賽的。

sentences.english: Besides, there is a counter-criticism against the critical mode of "elitism".
sentences.chinese: 此外，還對“精英主義”的批評模式提出了反批評。

sentences.english: of seats in elite colleges and universities?
sentences.chinese: 那麼對於進入精英院校的坐席的分配問題呢？

sentences.english: Mr. Yang Kehe is the management elite with foresight and dedicated spirit.
sentences.chinese: 遠見卓識富有奉獻精神的管理精英。

sentences.english: When they grow up, they are not only the social elites, but also our national backbone.
sentences.chinese: 他們長大了不僅是社會的精英，也是國家的棟樑。

sentences.english: How to enjoy the fashionable life of the elites?
sentences.chinese: 如何暢享主流精英階層時尚生活？

sentences.english: Mr Bush senior reduced Mr Dukakis to the candidate of card-carrying liberal elitists .
sentences.chinese: 老布什也曾經攻擊杜卡基斯是招牌式的自由派精英。

sentences.english: The appropriate direction lost many elites in those early annuals, it was under the archaic divine tree to fair cage him.
sentences.chinese: 當年正道損失無數精英，纔將他困在上古神木之下。

sentences.english: CS is a great computer game.
sentences.chinese: 反恐精英是一部很棒的電腦遊戲。

sentences.english: They are classic members - honorary members by definition - of China's new people's army of volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 他們是一羣精英，是新“中國人民自願軍”志願者。

sentences.english: With accelerating development, we are looking for the following positions to work in our Huizhou office.
sentences.chinese: 爲了配合公司迅速發展，擬向社會誠聘如下精英。

sentences.english: Eunuchs were once members of the elite in many societies.
sentences.chinese: 閹人曾經在許多社會中是精英中的成員。

sentences.english: This one is about how Congo's elite has underdeveloped this vast, poor, mineral-rich country
sentences.chinese: 這個笑話是講述剛果的精英如何發展他們的國家的。

sentences.english: Teacher, I wish you the education students, a galaxy of talents, the elite men.
sentences.chinese: 老師，祝您教育的學生，人才濟濟，精英輩出。

definition: peak/apex/world best/number one/finest (competitors)/top (figures in a certain field)
Cenozoic (geological era covering the last 65m years)
to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
diaphysis (long segment of a bone)/fig. backbone
